channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Productively Scheepers spaces and their relatives
item.description: arXiv:2602.16046v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove that assuming $\mathfrak{b}=\mathfrak{d}$, in the class of hereditarily Lindel\"of spaces, each productively Scheepers space is productively Hurewicz. The above statement remains true in the class of all general topological spaces assuming that $\mathfrak{d}=\aleph_1$. To this end we use combinatorial methods and the Menger covering property parametrized by ultrafilters. We also show that if near coherence of filters holds, then the Scheepers property is equivalent to a Menger property parametrized by any ultrafilter.
item.dc:creator: Marta K{\l}ad\'z-Duda, Piotr Szewczak, Lyubomyr Zdomskyy

item.title: Complexity of deep computations via topology of function spaces
item.description: arXiv:2601.00528v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We use topological methods to study complexity of deep computations and limit computations. We use topology of function spaces, specifically, the classification Rosenthal compacta, to identify new complexity classes. We use the language of model theory, specifically, the concept of \emph{independence} from Shelah's classification theory, to translate between topology and computation. We use the theory of Rosenthal compacta to characterize approximablility of deep computations, both deterministically and probabilistically.
item.dc:creator: Eduardo Due\~nez, Jos\'e Iovino, Tonatiuh Matos-Wiederhold, Luciano Salvetti, Franklin D. Tall
